Create a fire-resistant barrier: Create a fire-resistant barrier around your home using fire-resistant materials such as brick, stone, or concrete. This will help contain the fire and prevent it from spreading to other parts of the house.

Install a fire sprinkler system: A fire sprinkler system is an automatic fire suppression system that uses water to extinguish fires. They are typically installed in commercial buildings but can also be installed in homes.
Use a fire extinguisher: Fire extinguishers are portable devices that use chemicals to extinguish small fires. They can be used to put out fires in the early stages before they spread.

Practice fire escape drills: Practice fire escape drills with your family to ensure that everyone knows what to do in case of a fire. This includes identifying two exits from each room and practicing escaping from the house.
Keep a fire extinguisher in the kitchen: The kitchen is a common area for fires to occur, so keeping a fire extinguisher nearby can be helpful in case of a fire.
